intro: Verbascum cucullatibracteum, commonly known as the hooded mullein, is a perennial plant native to the mountainous regions of Central Asia. It belongs to the Scrophulariaceae family and is characterized by its tall, hairy stems and large, velvety leaves. The plant produces showy, yellow flowers in clusters, typically blooming in late summer. It thrives in rocky or sandy soils and is adapted to high-altitude environments. Due to its unique morphology and habitat, it is a subject of interest in botanical studies and conservation efforts.
